DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to descript the basis of definitive diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Supplying or being a final or conclusive settlement or result._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: All cell types, depending on their functions, have unique, identifiable "signatures" - special characteristics such as which genes are active and what proteins or other cellular products are manufactured by the cell.  During transformation of a normal cell to a cancer cell, the signature changes, and that change becomes a signal of the presence of cancer.  (Bypass Budget)

Concepts.definition: All cell types, depending on their functions, have unique, identifiable "signatures" - special characteristics such as which genes are active and what proteins or other cellular products are manufactured by the cell.  During transformation of a normal cell to a cancer cell, the signature changes, and that change becomes a signal of the presence of cancer.  (Bypass Budget)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.  -- 2004
